result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 7th and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 7th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dan O Mesch was found guilty of OWI 7th, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dan O Mesch in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Dan O Mesch in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton advises of change of plea and sentencing.  State gives joint recommendation.   State lists six prior convictions.  Attorney Middleton agrees with recommendation noted and agrees with the prior convictions notes.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  State makes final statement.  Attorney Middleton gives closing statement.  Defendant makes statement to court.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:  OWI-7
WI State Prison for 7 years (3 years Initial Confinement/4 years Extended Supervision)  279 days credit.
DNA surcharge $250/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
36 month revocation
36 month IID upon licensure
$25.00 Blood draw fee
$1424.00 Costs & Supervision Fees
Absolute sobriety at all times
May not go upon premises where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No oper of MV w/out valid DL
Seek and maintain full time employment
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Earned Release
Paperwork handed in court.

State advises of waiver and request an argn. date.  Attorney Steinman agrees.  Court goes through waiver information with defendant.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Set for ARGN. motion to modify bond is denied

Defendant Dan O Mesch in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Defendant Dan O Mesch in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  DE's motion to modify bond.  Atty Steinman makes argument.  Says DE would agree to go directly into a program through the veteran's program upon release from custody.  State responds against bond modification.  Atty Steinman responds/requests $1,000 cash bond as DE can raise that much.  Court states he will withhold ruling on this pending receiving some information from the VA re: the program.  Atty Steinman to get that information to the Court w/in 24 hours.  Matter can then be reset if the State continues to object.  Bond continues pending further notice.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Dan O Mesch in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Dan O Mesch in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Woodard responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times, not to operate any MV, not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores and must submit to chemical test if requested to do so by law enforcement.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 11:15 am.
